main event: A civilian reported a strange aircraft with aerials resembling a strato-cruiser at dawn in Mankato, Kansas. The aircraft was luminous red in color and appeared to be stationary above the horizon.
interesting points: The aircraft had aerials with white lights at the top, which were clearly outlined.
The witness observed the aircraft disappearing in an irregular line, with only the white light of the aerial remaining for a few moments.
The phenomenon lasted for several minutes, possibly five, before the aircraft disappeared.
The witness raised questions about the nature and origin of the phenomenon, as well as the existence of similar aircraft and reports from others who might have seen it.
The Air Force suggested that the observed object was likely one of the new radar-search aircraft designated WR-2, with the same configuration as a strato-cruiser.
sighted object: luminous red aircraft with aerials resembling a strato-cruiser
